name: Cirrate Haircap Moss
description: Pogonatum cirratum is a species of haircap moss native to various regions. Haircap mosses are characterized by their distinctive spore capsules that have a hairy cap (calyptra) covering them. This moss forms dense, green cushions or mats and thrives in moist, shaded environments. It's an excellent choice for terrariums where it can create a natural, forest-floor appearance. The moss helps maintain humidity and provides a natural substrate for other small plants. It's particularly useful for creating realistic miniature landscapes in terrariums.
careTips: Prefers low to moderate indirect light
Keep consistently moist - never let dry out
Can grow on soil, rocks, or wood
Slow-growing but forms dense mats over time
Excellent for creating natural terrarium landscapes
